greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Square array: A(row,col) = A263273(A265345(row,col)) = 2^row * A263273(A265341(col)).
comment: Square array A(row,col) is read by downwards antidiagonals as: A(0,0), A(0,1), A(1,0), A(0,2), A(1,1), A(2,0), A(0,3), A(1,2), A(2,1), A(3,0), ...
Shares with arrays A135764, A253551 and A254053 the property that odd terms are on the top row and when going downward in each column, terms grow by doubling.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..7381; the antidiagonals 0 .. 120 of the array
Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
example: The top left corner of the array:
xref: Differs from A135764 for the first time at n=16, where a(16) = 15, while A135764(16) = 11.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Dec 18 2015
